usefulItems: toothpick, parchment paper, baking dish (9 in. x 13 in.), icing spatula, large bowl, serving platter, oven
title: Flourless Chocolate Coffin Cake

ingredients.content: 10 oz unsalted butter, room temperature, plus extra to grease
10 oz dark chocolate (70% cocoa), cut into pieces
7 oz dark chocolate (70% cocoa), cut into pieces
1 ½ tsp gel food coloring, black

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a baking dish, line with parchment and set aside.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg whites and 3 oz sugar into mixing bowl and whip <b>5-6 min/speed 3.5<b> until stiff peaks are formed. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>, transfer whipped egg whites into a large bowl and set aside.
Place chocolate and hazelnuts into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and heat <b>2 min 30 sec/160°F/speed 2<b>.

Add egg yolks and 3 oz sugar and mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Gently fold chocolate mixture with spatula into reserved whipped egg whites until fully combined. Pour batter into prepared baking dish and bake for 35 minutes (350°F) or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before frosting (approx. 1 hr.).
Place chocolate, whipping cream and gel food coloring into mixing bowl and heat <b>2-3 min/110°F/speed 3<b> until melted.

Place a serving platter upside down over the cooled cake and carefully invert cake onto platter. Carefully remove baking dish and peel off parchment. Trim cake as needed with a sharp knife for straight edges (see Tip). Spread Ganache evenly on top of cake and down the sides with an icing spatula. Decorate to taste and allow frosting to set before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Sprinkle chocolate wafer cookie crumbs on serving platter to look like dirt. Place coffin cake on top of wafer "dirt" crumbs and add a few gummy worms next to the coffin.

Cut cake to resemble a traditional coffin shape by cutting a 1 inch triangle from one corner of the cake. Cut opposite corner to match; this will be the top end of coffin. Cut long, narrow triangles (1 in. x 4 in.) off bottom corners to form bottom end. Decorate to your liking.
